page.title: 07OTHER CHURCHILL CHURCHES
page.content: St. James's Church, Sarsden was built in 1760. It stands alongside Sarsden House in beautiful grounds. The interior is plain, the most distinguished feature being the fine organ. A lean-to extension, possibly of Tudor origin , is at the SW end. This has a castellated parapet and pointed arches. Holy Communion is celebrated twice monthly. Churchill Methodist Chapel was built in 1927, at a cost of Â£l,400, on land given by a local farmer. Stone was quarried at Chadlington, the wooden chairs made from local elm, and the gates made by the local blacksmith. Services are held on alternate Sundays, conducted by visiting preachers. A United Service, Anglicans and Methodists, is held on Good Friday. The Women's World Day of Prayer takes place alternate years.
